name: mine construction, gold | mine infrastructure, gold | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9126/documentation

This dataset describes the production of 1 unit of gold mine infrastructure. It includes land use and building and machinery consumption, as both in underground and surface (i.e. open pits) mining. Data correspond to those operations/plants that operates mostly underground mining and some open pits, specifically: AngloGold Ahanti, Harmony, Sibanye and GoldFields. 

From unoccupied land foreseen for a gold mine.

This activity ends with the transformation of occupied land, in time.

The dataset includes land transformation and occupation during the different stages of the mine, as well as the consumption of buildings and machinery for underground mining.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Land use of South-African mine, other inputs based on rough assumptions. Most of the mining operation and unrefined gold production activities are in an area called Witwatersrand basin. The are is approximately 350 km long and 200 km wide: the gold mines in this area are possibly  the deepest in the world (mining operation at 3600 m  and explortion core-drilling up to 4600 m.  ;MINE DEPTH: Mine depht: South Africa has thin and extensive precious metal reefs often lying several kilometres beneath the earth’s surface and usually slopes dips at up to 20 degrees. The country’s gold and somehow platinum corporations have to sink the deepest mine shafts in the world sometimes close to 4000 m for Gold in depths to reach and extract t he reefs; the  mine depth rages from 2,6 km t up to 4 km beneath the earth’s surface and an average depth is of about 3,335 km.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The mine is foreseen to have a lifetime of 50 years.;In South Africa haulage from underground is generally not done by conveyer belt, but through hoisting
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Buildings and machinery are based on global assumptions. The figures are extrapolated on the basis of the ore production. Transformation and occupation figures have been calculate as weighted average according to the shares of production, so as to represent an average gold mining site. One additional data, not reported in the Exchanges, but it's worth to mention, is the so-called Mining Rigth Land: this figure for an average gold mining site is of 3,56E+07 m2; values range from 5,03E+04 m2 to 6,11E+08 m2. Data are from years 2012-2016.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Companies operational and environmental reports:                                      AngloGlodAshanti Limited, Integrated Report, 2016	
AngloGlodAshanti Limited, Sustainable Development Report, 2016	
AngloGoldAshanti Limited,  Vaal River Operational Report, 2016	
AngloGoldAshanti Limited,  West Wits Operational Report, 2016	
GoldFields, Integrated Annual Report, 2016	
GoldFields, GRI G4 Content Index, 2016	
Harmony, Integrated Annual Report, 2016	
Harmony, Operational Performance, 2016	
SibanyeGold, Integrated Annual Report, 2016

exchanges.description:
The infrastructure represent an average gold ungerground mine site in South Africa.
EcoSpold01Location=ZA

flow.name: mine infrastructure, gold
flow.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

exchanges.description: Calculated value from companies reports from the total disturbed land. The value is a weighted average (geomean) and it's quite robust since it correlates quite well with the median of the same set of samples (R=0,9963349)

EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation: As of this exchange, mine construction process represents that of underground mining, and is assumed to be equivalent o the one depicted in the ecoinvent generic dataset (v2) "non-ferrous metal, mine, underground", in Part XIV of cited source.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value from companies reports from the total disturbed land. The value is a weighted average (geomean) and it's quite robust since it correlates quite well with the median of the same set of samples (R=0,9963349).The entire area of the mine is not in active use at one time; "disturbed area in active use" values reported in literature are assumed to be the average share of the mine area in use along 50 years of operation.

The occupation of the mine was then calculated as:

Ocupation, mineral extraction site = (Total disturbed area in active use) * 50 years = 6.78E+07 m2 * 50 years = 5,28E+08 m2y

Estimation: As of this exchange, mine construction process represents that of underground mining, and is assumed to be equivalent o the one depicted in the ecoinvent generic dataset (v2) "non-ferrous metal, mine, underground", in Part XIV of cited source.
EcoSpold01Location=CH
